thread.title: Citi To Pay $700 Million To Consumers Over Illegal Credit Card Practices
thread.title_full: Citi To Pay $700 Million To Consumers Over Illegal Credit Card Practices - Forbes

author: Lauren Gensler
title: Citi To Pay $700 Million To Consumers Over Illegal Credit Card Practices
text:
Citi has been ordered to pay $700 million to consumers who were hurt by deceptive and illegal credit card practices, plus $70 million in fines, regulators said on Tuesday.
Some 8.8 million consumers were allegedly impacted by deceptive marketing and billing for credit card services and add-on products like debt protection and credit monitoring, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said in a statement.
For instance, Citi allegedly charged consumers for memberships they were told were free during the first 30 days or for products they never received.
“We continue to uncover illegal credit card add-on practices that are costing unknowing consumers millions of dollars,” said CFPB Director Richard Cordray in a statement. “In our four years, this is the tenth action we’ve taken against companies in this space for deceiving consumers. We will remain on the lookout for similar conduct and will address it as we find it.”
Citi said in a statement that it “previously discontinued sales of the products included in the agreements,” like credit monitoring and debt-protection products.
The enforcement action comes from the consumer watchdog agency established exactly five years ago under Dodd-Frank. The agency has been tough on credit card practices and just earlier this month took action against JPMorgan for selling bad credit card debt.
